Centroid an mzML file with Configurable Peak Picking Parameters

Source: R/centroid_one_file.R
centroid_one_file.Rd

Centroid an mzML file with Configurable Peak Picking Parameters

Usage

centroid_one_file(
  file,
  pattern,
  replacement,
  fixed = TRUE,
  smooth_method = "SavitzkyGolay",
  smooth_window = 6L,
  refine_mz = "descendPeak",
  ms1_peak_snr = 1L,
  ms1_signal_percentage = 33,
  ms2_peak_snr = 1L,
  ms2_signal_percentage = 50,
  min_peaks = 1000
)

Arguments

file

Path to the input mzML file

pattern

Pattern to replace in file path

replacement

Replacement string for output path

fixed

Logical, whether pattern matching should be fixed

smooth_method

Smoothing method for spectra

smooth_window

Half window size for smoothing

refine_mz

Refining method

ms1_peak_snr

Signal-to-noise ratio for MS1 peak picking

ms1_signal_percentage

Signal percentage for MS1 peak refinement

ms2_peak_snr

Signal-to-noise ratio for MS2 peak picking

ms2_signal_percentage

Signal percentage for MS2 peak refinement

min_peaks

Minimum number of peaks to retain a spectrum

Value

Logical indicating success of centroiding

Author

Johannes Rainer
